page.description: OBJ() returns an pointer to the object specified by Object_Address.

argument.name: object_name
argument.description: The "name" of the object, as in :customer:button1.

section.title: Example
section.description: This script returns a pointer to the current form, then lists its child objects.
section.example: dim ptr as P ptr = obj(a_form_current) ui_msg_box("Child Objects of this Form", ptr.child_enum() )

section.description: The following script tests to see if a form called "customer" has been loaded. If not, it loads the form.
section.example: p = obj(":customer") if (.not. is_object(p)) then :form.view("customer") end if
